WorldPop datasets are generally CC BY 4.0; verify per layer and record attribution text.

candidates.name: Population Counts
candidates.title: Population Counts
candidates.desc:
WorldPop produces different types of gridded population count datasets, depending on the methods used and end application. Please make sure you have read our page on choosing the right WorldPop population data before downloading a dataset.

Bespoke methods designed in co-production with governments and UN agencies to produce datasets for specific countries are available through the WorldPop Open Population Repository (WOPR), and can be visually explored through the WoprVision App. These are 100m resolution gridded population estimates developed for a single recent time point using local data and tailored covariates in customized models. Before accessing the multi-temporal global datasets below, consider whether these bespoke data may fit your needs as they likely represent more accurate estimates when single recent timepoint datasets for specific countries are required.

For users interested in gridded population datasets covering all countries and multiple years, produced using consistent methods, the ‘Global2’ datasets available here may fit your needs. Please read our blog describing the general features of these data or our more technically detailed release statement before using them. Here, country-specific population count datasets at 100m and 1km spatial resolution, and global datasets at 1km resolution are available for each year from 2015 to 2030 in Geotiff format. More information can be found in the Release Statement.

If you are looking for our old 'Global1' 2000-2020 datasets, then these are archived here.

candidates.name: Age and sex structures
candidates.title: Age and sex structures
candidates.desc:
WorldPop produces different types of gridded population count datasets, depending on the methods used and end application. Please make sure you have read our page on choosing the right WorldPop population data before downloading a dataset.

Bespoke methods designed in co-production with governments and UN agencies to produce datasets for specific countries are available through the WorldPop Open Population Repository (WOPR), and can be visually explored through the WoprVision App. These are 100m resolution gridded population estimates developed for a single recent time point using local data and tailored covariates in customized models. Before accessing the multi-temporal global datasets below, consider whether these bespoke data may fit your needs as they likely represent more accurate estimates when single recent timepoint datasets for specific countries are required.
For users interested in gridded population datasets covering all countries and multiple years, produced using consistent methods, the ‘Global2’ datasets available here may fit your needs. Please read our blog describing the general features of these data or our more technically detailed release statement before using them.
Here, country-specific population count datasets disaggregated by age and sex at 100m and 1km spatial resolution, and global datasets at 1km resolution are available for each year from 2015 to 2030 in Geotiff format. More information can be found in the Release Statement.

If you are looking for our old ‘Global1’ 2000-2020 datasets, then these are archived here.

candidates.name: Population Density
candidates.title: Population Density
candidates.desc:
WorldPop produces different types of gridded population count datasets, depending on the methods used and end application. Please make sure you have read our Mapping Populations overview page before choosing and downloading a dataset.

Datasets are available to download in Geotiff and ASCII XYZ format at a resolution of 30 arc-seconds (approximately 1km at the equator)
-Unconstrained individual countries 2000-2020: Population density datasets for all countries of the World for each year 2000-2020 – derived from the corresponding Unconstrained individual countries 2000-2020 population count datasets by dividing the number of people in each pixel by the pixel surface area. These are produced using the unconstrained top-down modelling method.
-Unconstrained individual countries 2000-2020 UN adjusted: Population density datasets for all countries of the World for each year 2000-2020 – derived from the corresponding Unconstrained individual countries 2000-2020 population UN adjusted count datasets by dividing the number of people in each pixel, adjusted to match the country total from the official United Nations population estimates (UN 2019), by the pixel surface area. These are produced using the unconstrained top-down modelling method.

Note: These datasets is based on WorldPop Global1 data (2018)

notes: WorldPop API discovery varies by product; if this script cannot resolve a direct download URL, it will record candidates so you can pick the right one.

dataset: World Bank - World Development Indicators (via V2 API)
license: See World Bank data terms for each indicator/source; many datasets are CC BY 4.0 but verify.
